Croatia in january: average Weather, Temperature and Climate, Where to go?

Best time to go to Croatia

Weather in Croatia in january 2025

In this section, find the the weather forecast for the month of january for most popular cities in Croatia. These predictions are statistics for the month of january from weather reports for over 10 years. The percentage indicates the possibility of having the weather indicated.

Where should you go in Croatia in january when it comes to the weather?

Remember:

The climate in Croatia in january ranges from bad to very bad depending on the region and city.

Fresh temperatures and wet days characterize the climate throughout January in Croatia throughout the country. In fact, one can expect these climatic conditions since January is at the heart of the winter season. However, because of the influence of height on the climate, the coldness is more accentuated in the vicinity of Zagreb - while on the coast and in the south especially, the temperatures in midday are relatively mild.

Janaury on the Adriatic Coast

The cities bordering the Adriatic Sea benefit from the positive influence of the sea on the climate, since the climatic conditions there are less severe than those of the inland. In fact, it is rare to see the temperatures during the day fall below 5° C - whereas by midday, it is possible to feel a comfortable, thanks to a few degrees gained over the hours.

January in the Croatian Islands

Although humidity continues to characterize the weather throughout January in Croatia, the rains in the Croatian islands are slightly weak and the days are often characterized by the alternating shy sun and the overcast sky. As the temperatures are relatively mild, the weather is suitable to recharge and enjoy a few beautiful sunny days. It is enough to cover well in order to feel comfortable during walks and outings.

January on Inland

Cold temperatures, overcast skies and thick morning mists define the weather in Croatia throughout January on inland. Even Gospic, a town not far from the coast, experiences frequent episodes of snowfall occurring at any time of the day. The same is true of Zagreb and its surroundings. Despite the soft presence of the sun, temperatures remain cool to the point that it is recommended to bundle before leaving the house.

Climate in Croatia in january

Climate in Zagreb in january

In january, the mean temperature in Zagreb is 2°C (maximum temperature is 4°C and minimum temperature is -1°C). The climate is rather more than very fresh in that locality in the month of january. Do not forget to cover yourself! With 72mm over 4 days, rain may occur for your vacations. But this is rather moderate and you will not be too bothered by it.

Climate in Dubrovnik in january

In january, maximum temperature is 11°C and minimum temperature is 8°C (for an average temperature of 9°C). The climate is fairly cold around this city in this month, but it is tolerable when dressing cosy. With 232mm over 9 days, rain is to be feared for your holidays. Consider to pack adapted clothes.

With a bad climate, the month of january is not the best time to go in that area in Croatia.

Climate in Croatian islands (Hvar, Brac,Mljet...) in january

In the month of january, the mean temperature in Croatian islands (Brac,Mljet...) is 10°C (maximum temperature is 11°C and minimum temperature is 9°C). The climate is quite fresh there in january, but it is tolerable by dressing warm. With 126mm over 8 days, you risk getting wet slightly for your holidays. But this is reasonably and it will not be continuous.

With an unfavorable weather, january is not recommended month to go in this locality.

Climate in Plitvice Lakes National Park in january

In the month of january, the mean temperature in Plivice National Park is 1°C (maximum temperature is 4°C and minimum temperature is -2°C). The climate is rather more than very fresh around this city in the month of january. Plan a sweater! With 171mm over 8 days, you will experience some showers throughout your stay. But this is rather moderate and you will not be too bothered by it.

In the month of january, the mean temperature in Pula is 8°C (maximum temperature is 10°C and minimum temperature is 7°C). The climate is relatively cold in that area in this month, but it is tolerable by dressing cosy. With 149mm over 7 days, rain may occur for your holidays. But this is pretty reasonably and it is only of temporary showers.

Weather data for Croatia in january:

Weather data for Croatia in january is derived from an average of the weather forecast since 2009 in Croatia. There is a margin of error and these forecasts are to be considered as general information only. The weather in Croatia can vary slightly from year to year, but these predictions should limit surprises. So you can pack your bags and check when is the best time to go to Croatia.
